column5: He was the first.
He was the first to live in the White House.
He spoke 6 different languages.
He was the smallest President: 5'4" under 100 lbs.
He died on the 4th of July.
He was the son of John Adams.
He was the first President to ride a train.
He was the first President to be born as an American citizen.
He was only in office for 31 days before dying of pnueumonia.
He had 15 children.
He was the first President to serve a nation from coast to coast.
He never voted for a President.
He was the first President to have running water in the White House.
He Memorized his entire inaugural speech.
He never married.
He was the tallest President and was the first President to be assassinated.
He was burried wrapped in an American flag with a copy of the Constitution.
He was fined $20 for speeding in his horse and carriage.
He was the first President to use a phone(his phone number was 1).
He could write with both hands at the same time(in different languages).
He changed his pants several times a day(he owned 80 pairs of pants).
He was the first and only President married in the White House.
He was the first President to have electric lights and a Christmas tree in the White House.
He was the first and only President to serve 2 non-consecutive terms.
He was the first President to use campaign buttons.
He was the youngest President.
He was the heaviest President(332 lbs).
He dreamed of being a stage performer.
He gambled away a set of White House china.
He was the only president born on the 4th of July.
He spoke chinese to his wife to keep their stories private.
He was the only President to serve more than 2 terms.
He read every book in his hometown library.
He was the commander of Allied Forces during World War II.
He was the first Catholic President.
He was an auto mechanic and teacher before being President.
He recommended a play to the Miami Dolphins in Super Bowl VI.
He held his daughter's High School prom in the White House.
He was the first President born in a hospital.
He was the oldest President(69-77).
He survived 4 plane crashes during World War II.
He Played the saxophone on national TV.
He has a collection of over 250 signed baseballs.
He was the first African-American President
He was the first president to ever have received a Stone Cold Stunner from Stone Cold Steve Austin.
